meanings.definition: A person who wears a mask or fantastic costume while merrymaking or taking part in a pantomime.
meanings.sent1: During the festival, the mummers danced joyfully in their colorful costumes.
meanings.sent2: The mummers paraded through the streets, bringing cheer to all who watched.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as the mummers tried to sneak up on each other in their masks.
meanings.sent4: The mummers, like chameleons, transformed into characters from a different world.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mummers' masks stayed vivid in the minds of the spectators long after the celebration ended.

meanings.definition: A performer in a traditional masked mime, especially of a type associated with Christmas and popular in England in the 18th and 19th centuries.
meanings.sent1: The mummers entertained the crowd with their silent performance.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, mummers would act out stories without saying a word.
meanings.sent3: The mummers' exaggerated gestures made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Their movements were so precise, the mummers seemed like living statues.
meanings.sent5: The mummers' artistry transported the viewers to a world of silent wonder.
